name: Path N Vulva
title: Pathologic N
notes:
**Note 1:** Histological examination of an inguinofemoral lymphadenectomy specimen will ordinarily include 6 or more lymph nodes. If the lymph nodes are negative, but the number ordinarily examined is not met, classify as pN0. (FIGO considers such cases as pNX). 

**Note 2:**  Code only regional nodes and nodes, NOS, in this field.  Distant nodes are coded in distant metastasis. 

**Note 3:** For regional lymph nodes, assign the appropriate N category based on the number of positive nodes.

    Deep inguinal, NOS
    Femoral
    Inguinal NOS
    Inguinofemoral (groin)  
    Node of Cloquet or Rosenmuller (highest deep inguinal)
    Superficial inguinal (femoral) 

    Regional lymph node(s), NOS
    Lymph nodes, NOS 

**Note 4:**  Assign N1 [NOS] if regional lymph nodes are involved but the number of nodes involved is unknown.

**Note 5:**  When both the Federation Internationale de Gynecologie et d'Obstetrique (FIGO) stage and regional lymph node detail are available, record the code with regional lymph node detail in preference to a statement of FIGO stage. FIGO Stage IVA is assigned based on tumor extension and/or regional lymph node involvement.  Code Regional Lymph Nodes based on a physician's statement of FIGO Stage IVA only if it is known that the stage value is assigned because of regional lymph node involvement.
rows: Regional lymph nodes cannot be assessed

Unknown; regional lymph nodes not stated
Not documented in patient record
Regional lymph node metastasis with the following features

Note: N1 has subcategories of N1a and N1b. Assign N1 only when there is no information available to assign one of the subcategories

1 or 2 regional lymph node(s) positive (or number positive unknown) and size of metastasis not given

FIGO Stage IIIA or III [NOS]

Stated as N1 [NOS]
1-2 lymph node metastasis each less than 5 mm
1 lymph node metastasis 5 mm or greater
Regional lymph node metastasis with the following features

Note: N2 has subcategories of N2a and N2b. Assign N2 only when there is no information available to assign one of the subcategories

3 or more regional lymph node(s) positive and size of metastases not given

FIGO Stage IIIB

Stated as N2 [NOS]
3 or more lymph node metastases each less than 5 mm

3 or more regional lymph nodes positive and size of metastasis in each node less than 5 mm

Stated as N2a
2 or more lymph node metastases 5 mm or greater

At least 2 lymph node metastases equal to or greater than 5 mm

Stated as N2b
Lymph node  metastases with extracapsular spread

Regional lymph node(s) with extracapsular spread

FIGO Stage IIIC

Stated as N2c
Fixed or ulcerated regional lymph node metastasis

Fixed or ulcerated regional lymph nodes

FIGO Stage IVA based on regional lymph node involvement

Stated as N3
